triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: The paper leverages large language models as the foundation for the LLM agents that implement the ExpeL methodology.

triples.name: Decision-making
triples.relevance: The paper addresses decision-making tasks as the primary application domain for the ExpeL agent.

triples.name: Transfer learning
triples.relevance: The paper explores transfer learning potential to demonstrate how ExpeL agents can apply learned experiences across different tasks.

triples.name: GPT-4
triples.relevance: GPT-4 is explicitly cited as an example of state-of-the-art language models accessible through API calls that the ExpeL approach targets.

triples.name: Claude (language model)
triples.relevance: Claude is explicitly cited as another example of state-of-the-art language models with proprietary weights that the ExpeL methodology can work with.

triples.name: Experiential learning
triples.relevance: The paper introduces ExpeL (Experiential Learning) as a novel agent paradigm that learns from experiences without parametric updates.

triples.name: Intelligent agent
triples.relevance: The paper proposes an intelligent agent design that autonomously gathers experiences and makes informed decisions based on past experiences.

triples.name: Knowledge extraction
triples.relevance: The ExpeL agent autonomously extracts knowledge from training tasks using natural language, which is a core component of the proposed methodology.

triples.name: Inference engine
triples.relevance: At inference time, the agent recalls extracted insights and past experiences to make informed decisions about tasks.
